gurmukhi: swc khI bsudyvih mo pih so prq`iC BeI hm jwnXo ] qw idn dwn Anyk dIXO sB ibpRn byd AsIs bKwnXo ]92]
transliteration: Saach Kahibasudevah(i) Mo Paih So Partachchh(i) Bhaiham Jaanyo|| Taa Din Daan Anek Deeyau Sabh Bipran Bed Asees Bakhaanyo||92
translation: He began to think about the waning given to him by Vasudev, which was true and he was seeing the same apparently; on that day Nand gave charity to Brahmins in various ways, who gave him many blessings.92.

gurmukhi: bwl rUp hÍY auqirXo dXw isMD krqwr ] piRQm aupwrI pUqnw BUm auqwrXo Bwr ]93]
transliteration: Baal Roop Hvai Outariyo Dayaa Sindh Kartaar|| Priham Udhaaripootanaa Bhoom Outdaryo Bhaar||93||
translation: The Lord, ocean of mercy has incarnated in the form of a child and in the first place he has liberated the earth from the bufden of Putna.93.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm skMD purwxy bicqR nwtk pUqnw bD iDAwie smwpqM ]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sakandh Puraane Bachitra Naatak Pootanaa Badh Dhiaae Samaaptan||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled “Killing of Putna” based on Dasham Sakandh Purana in Bachittar Natak.
Now begins the description of Naming Ceremony

gurmukhi: bwsdyv qb grg kO inkit su khI bTwie ] gokl nMdih ky Bvn kiRpw kro qum jwie ]94]
transliteration: Baasdev Tab Gadg Kau Nikattee Su Kahibathaae|| Gokal Nandah(i) Ke Bhavan Kridaa Daro Toum Jaae||94||
translation: Then Vasudev requested the family-preceptor Garg to kindly go to Gokul in the house of Nand.94.

gurmukhi: auqY qwq hmrY qhw nwm krn kr dyhu ] hm qum ibnu nhI jwnhI Aaur sÍn sun lyhu ]95]
transliteration: Outai Taat Hamrai Tahaa Naam Karan Kar Dehu|| Ham Toum Bin(i) Nahijaan-hiaur Sravan Soun Lehu||95
translation: My son is there, kindly perform the naming ceremony and take care that no one else knows his secret except you and me.95.

gurmukhi: byg clXo idj gokl kO bsudyv mhwn khI soeI mwnI ] nMd ky Dwm gXo qb hI bhu Awdr qwih krXo nMd rwnI ]
transliteration: Beg Chadyo Dij Gokal Kau Basudev Mahaan Kahisoimaanee|| Nand Ke Dhaam Gado Tab Hibahu Aadar Taah(i) Daryo Nand Raanee||
translation: Accepting the saying of Vasudev, the Brahmin Garg quickly started for Gokul and reached the house of Nand, where he was warmly received by the wife of Nand.

gurmukhi: nwm su kiRSn khXo ieh ko kr mwn leI ieh bwq bKwnI ] lwie lgMn inC`qRn soD khI smJwie AkQ khwnI ]96]
kiRSn nwm qw ko DrXo grgih mnYN ibcwir ] iSAwm plotY pwie ijh ieh sm mno murwr ]97]
transliteration: Krishan Naam Taa Ko Ddaryo Gadgad(i) Manain Bicdaar(i)|| Shiaam Plotai Paae Jih Eh Sam Mano Muraar||97||
translation: Garg thought out in his mind and gave the name of Krishna to the boy and when the boy raised his feet, it seemed to the Pundit that he was similar to that of Vishnu.97.

gurmukhi: sukl brn siqjug Bey pIq brn qRyqwie ] pRIq brn pt isAwm qn nr nwhin ky nwih ]98]
transliteration: Soukal Baran Sat(i)joug Bhae Peet Baran Tretaae|| Preet Baran Pat Siaam Tan Nar Naahan(i) Ke Naahe||98||
translation: The black colour is the symbol of Satyuga and the yellow of Treta, but wearing the yellow clothes and having the body of dark colour, both of these are not the characteristics of ordinary men.98.
